fields.headline: Snow show
fields.bodyText: Most European resorts have had mild temperatures with rain below 1,800m and wet snow above. North America has had a light dusting of new snow refreshing the pistes and creating great off-piste powder. Austria Light, overnight snow across the highest peaks, but daytime temperatures have been mild leading to soft snow. The best skiing is in St Anton (* * *) and Obergurgl (* * *) on the upper slopes. Conditions are deteriorating in Soll (* *) and Kitzbuhel (* *). France Still very mild. La Plagne (* * *) and Les Arcs (* * *), are best on the glaciers. Off-piste conditions are heavy in Argentière (* * *). New snow has refreshed the pistes at Serre Chevalier (* * * *) and Montgenevre (* * * *). Switzerland Spring conditions. The lower runs of Murren (* *), Grindelwald (* *), Crans Montana (* *), Verbier (* * *) and St Moritz (* * * *) are all suffering. Saas Fee (* * * *) is still excellent on the upper slopes and off piste. Italy Temperatures have stayed low and new snow has fallen. Cortina (* * * *), Cervinia (* * * *) and the Milky Way (* * * *) are excellent on-piste. Andorra Very mild temperatures and by midday most slopes are slushy. In Soldeu (* *), the best conditions being found first thing in the morning at altitude. US Excellent in all resorts. Aspen (* * * *) has fresh powder on the upper slopes. Scattered snow showers have also improved the pistes in Breckenridge (* * * *), but low cloud has led to poor visibility. In Killington (* * * *), some slopes become heavy towards the end of the day but on piste is generally very good. Canada New snow across the West Coast with up to 20cm for Panorama (* * * *). At Whistler (* * * *), the upper piste quality is excellent. In Sunshine Village (* * * *) near Banff, knee-high powder can be found among the trees.
